description:
Teenage country bumpkin Tatsumi dreams of earning enough money for his impoverished village by working in the Capital--but his short-lived plans go awry when he's robbed by a buxom beauty upon arrival! Penniless, Tatsumi is taken in by the lovely Miss Aria, but just when his Capital dreams seem in reach yet again, Miss Aria's mansion is besieged by Night Raid--a team of ruthless assassins who targets high-ranking members of the upper class! As Tatsumi is quick to learn, appearances can be deceiving in the Capital, and this team of assassins just might be...the good guys?!

(Source: Yen Press)

Note: Volumes 5 and 8 each contain a bonus chapter.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Alchemy
tags.description: Features character(s) who practice alchemy.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

name.native: セリュー・ユビキタス
メラルド・オールベルグ

node.description:
He founded the adult game brand [Minato Soft](http://minatosoft.com/t4p/) in 2006.

[Website](http://www.takahiro.ms/index.htm) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takahiro4p)

[Blog](https://dashofgreen.blogspot.com/)

She is an American freelance translator. She and her husband, letterer [James Dashiell](https://anilist.co/staff/225315/James-Dashiell) work as a team for lettering and translating manga.

[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/abigail-blackman) | [Twitter](https://x.com/dydreemblvr) | [Etsy](https://www.etsy.com/shop/dydreemblvr/?etsrc=sdt)

Thriving on doing a bit of everything, Abigail has been working in the US manga industry since 2008. Since leaving her in-house editorial role in 2013, Abigail has undertaken a wide range of freelance assignments including editing and localizing translated scripts; lettering and retouching for manga interiors; and designing promotional items, ads, and cover logos.
When she isn't panels-deep in a new manga project, Abigail enjoys various other creative pursuits, as well as generally being out of doors.
He is an American production artist, manager and retouch & lettering artist. He is spouse of [Christine Dashiell](https://anilist.co/staff/219441).

Edith Belarra was born in Huesca, Spain and licensed in Translation and Interpretation in the Universidad Autónoma de Barcelona, where she specialized in videogames. Her works consist mainly in translating from Japanese and English to Spanish.
